boat.construction_details: "pinky" stern, multichine welded hull, aluminium masts & bowsprit, wooden booms & gaffs
boat.full_description:
Wyvern is a replica “pinky,” a fishing type that was popular in New England and the Canadian Maritime Provinces from the mid- 18th to early 20th centuries. She was built by McConnell Marine Ltd at Parry Sound, a  port in Georgian Bay on the east side of Lake Huron, and spent her first 26  years at Port Hawkesbury and Halifax, Nova Scotia, under the names A E Huston,  then Caper Dreams, then to Kinsale, Virginia, name Arcturus.

The Institute  of Maritime History, a non-profit volunteer society dedicated to history and  underwater archaeology, now uses her for experimental archaeology, training, reconnaissance, and diving, mainly in the Chesapeake Bay.
boat.name: Wyvern
boat.short_description: Replica "pinky" fishing type mid 18th to early 20th century, New England and Canadian Maritimes
